text: Mihail Moxa (; after 1550-before 1650) was a Wallachian historiographer and translator. Nothing is known about his family, but Moxa was probably from the Oltenia region, and was a monk at the Bistrița Monastery. He knew Old Church Slavonic well, translating religious texts in a colorful and fluent style. He compiled the first extant chronicle in Romanian.Aurel Sasu (ed.), Dicționarul biografic al literaturii române, vol. II, p. 151.
